title: 'Come in We're Closed'
content:
Evening all,   
   
Can anyone help me identify the font Anthony Burrill uses for 'Come in...'   
   
 [http://www.anthonyburrill.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022075000/http:/www.anthonyburrill.com/)  
   
thanks in advance
author: dom

comments.content:
Just a note, the front page is a random image..   
   
 [http://www.anthonyburrill.com/images/sign2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022075000/http:/www.anthonyburrill.com/images/sign2.jpg)   
is the face in question.

Hey guys, sorry to pester n all..I'd really appreciate some help though..   
   
I'm still trying to findout the font used for 'Come In' in the postcard image below.   
   
  ![come in](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022075000im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33626.gif)

It's a near certainty that it's handlettering.   
   
"Come in We're Open" and "Sorry We're Closed" signs exactly like this have been sold at hardware stores for as long as I can remember. I'd say the designer scanned and combined them for this hybrid version.   
   
You might find a font with a similar style to the script, but I doubt very much you will find an exact match.

thanks mark   
   
yeah, mr.burrill simply switched the type from the signs to create the postcards ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022075000im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

[Sign DNA](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022075000/http:/www.signdna.com/v1/fontlist/) and [Signfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022075000/http:/artandsignstudio.com/fonts.html) are two other sources of similar script fonts.

Have a look at [Sarah Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022075000/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/contributors/charlesborges/sarahscript.shtml), [Scriptana](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022075000/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/letterheadfonts/scriptana.shtml) or [Stanford Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022075000/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/diptripflipfantasia/stanfordscript.shtml)  
at Letterhead Fonts, as well as House Industries'   
 [Sign Painter Font Collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022075000/http:/houseind.com/house.php?kit=SIGN-FO). Hope this helps.
